altSalesTotal.description: The alternate sales amount total is shown here.
altSalesTotal.name: altSalesTotal

billAddressList.externalId.description: Sets the billing address for this transaction. This field defaults to the default Billing Address set on the associated Customer record.Use CustomerAddressBookList on the Customer Record to retrieve a list of currently defined addresses for a specific customer. See AddressbookList.If an address has NOT been defined, you must first define an address on the Customer record in order to set a billing addess for this transaction.
billAddressList.externalId.name: billAddressList.externalId

billAddressList.internalId.description: Sets the billing address for this transaction. This field defaults to the default Billing Address set on the associated Customer record.Use CustomerAddressBookList on the Customer Record to retrieve a list of currently defined addresses for a specific customer. See AddressbookList.If an address has NOT been defined, you must first define an address on the Customer record in order to set a billing addess for this transaction.
billAddressList.internalId.name: billAddressList.internalId

billAddressList.name.description: Sets the billing address for this transaction. This field defaults to the default Billing Address set on the associated Customer record.Use CustomerAddressBookList on the Customer Record to retrieve a list of currently defined addresses for a specific customer. See AddressbookList.If an address has NOT been defined, you must first define an address on the Customer record in order to set a billing addess for this transaction.
billAddressList.name.name: billAddressList.name

ccApproved.description: Sets the status of the credit card to approved.
ccApproved.name: ccApproved

ccExpireDate.description: Sets the credit card expiration date.
ccExpireDate.name: ccExpireDate

ccName.description: Defaults to the cardholder name from the default credit card on the customer's record. If the default credit card is not selected in creditCard, you must provide this value.
ccName.name: ccName

ccNumber.description: Use this field to set the credit card number. Enter numbers only, without spaces. Partially masked values are not accepted. Only a 16-digit number is accepted.On a get, this value is masked.When searching on this field, you can use only the empty and notEmpty operators.
ccNumber.name: ccNumber

ccStreet.description: Defaults to the street address from the customer's billing address.
ccStreet.name: ccStreet

ccZipCode.description: Defaults to the zip or postal code from the customer's billing address.
ccZipCode.name: ccZipCode

createdFrom.externalId.description: This field shows the transaction type and number of the transaction this authorization was created from.Click the transaction number to open the transaction.
createdFrom.externalId.name: createdFrom.externalId

createdFrom.internalId.description: This field shows the transaction type and number of the transaction this authorization was created from.Click the transaction number to open the transaction.
createdFrom.internalId.name: createdFrom.internalId

createdFrom.name.description: This field shows the transaction type and number of the transaction this authorization was created from.Click the transaction number to open the transaction.
createdFrom.name.name: createdFrom.name

creditCard.externalId.description: References the credit card records associated with the customer record.
creditCard.externalId.name: creditCard.externalId

creditCard.internalId.description: References the credit card records associated with the customer record.
creditCard.internalId.name: creditCard.internalId

creditCard.name.description: References the credit card records associated with the customer record.
creditCard.name.name: creditCard.name

currency.externalId.description: If you do not use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, the currency of the customer you are creating this transaction for is shown here.If you use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, select the transaction currency you want to create this transaction in. This customer's primary currency is selected by default.If you have already selected items on this transaction, selecting a new currency refreshes them to show the price in the new currency (except for items you entered custom prices for) and recalculates tax and gross profit.
currency.externalId.name: currency.externalId

currency.internalId.description: If you do not use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, the currency of the customer you are creating this transaction for is shown here.If you use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, select the transaction currency you want to create this transaction in. This customer's primary currency is selected by default.If you have already selected items on this transaction, selecting a new currency refreshes them to show the price in the new currency (except for items you entered custom prices for) and recalculates tax and gross profit.
currency.internalId.name: currency.internalId

currency.name.description: If you do not use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, the currency of the customer you are creating this transaction for is shown here.If you use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, select the transaction currency you want to create this transaction in. This customer's primary currency is selected by default.If you have already selected items on this transaction, selecting a new currency refreshes them to show the price in the new currency (except for items you entered custom prices for) and recalculates tax and gross profit.
currency.name.name: currency.name

currencyName.description: A read only field that defaults to the currency associated with the customer referenced by the entity field.
currencyName.name: currencyName

customForm.externalId.description: Select the return authorization form you wish to use from the dropdown list.Click New to customize a new form.
customForm.externalId.name: customForm.externalId

customForm.internalId.description: Select the return authorization form you wish to use from the dropdown list.Click New to customize a new form.
customForm.internalId.name: customForm.internalId

customForm.name.description: Select the return authorization form you wish to use from the dropdown list.Click New to customize a new form.
customForm.name.name: customForm.name

deferredRevenue.description: Deferred Revenue:amount of revenue deferred on this transaction
deferredRevenue.name: deferredRevenue

department.externalId.description: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. This field is required when Make Departments Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.
department.externalId.name: department.externalId

department.internalId.description: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. This field is required when Make Departments Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.
department.internalId.name: department.internalId

department.name.description: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. This field is required when Make Departments Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.
department.name.name: department.name

discountItem.externalId.description: References a value in a user defined discount list. To create new values, click Lists > Accounting > Items > New > Discount.
discountItem.externalId.name: discountItem.externalId

discountItem.internalId.description: References a value in a user defined discount list. To create new values, click Lists > Accounting > Items > New > Discount.
discountItem.internalId.name: discountItem.internalId

discountItem.name.description: References a value in a user defined discount list. To create new values, click Lists > Accounting > Items > New > Discount.
discountItem.name.name: discountItem.name

discountRate.description: If the value entered here includes the percent sign, the discount rate applied to the item is calculated as a percent. If the value entered here does not include the percent sign, the discount rate is applied as an absolute discount value.For example, 10% would result in a ten percent discount on the item whereas 10 would result in a ten dollar discount on the item.
discountRate.name: discountRate

discountTotal.description: This is a read-only field that returns the amount discounted on this sales order.
discountTotal.name: discountTotal

drAccount.externalId.displayName: Deferred Revenue Reclassification Account - External id
drAccount.externalId.name: drAccount.externalId

drAccount.internalId.displayName: Deferred Revenue Reclassification Account - Internal id
drAccount.internalId.name: drAccount.internalId

entity.externalId.description: Required on Add. Sets the customer this return authorization is associated with.
entity.externalId.name: entity.externalId

entity.internalId.description: Required on Add. Sets the customer this return authorization is associated with.
entity.internalId.name: entity.internalId

entity.name.description: Required on Add. Sets the customer this return authorization is associated with.
entity.name.name: entity.name

entityTaxRegNum.externalId.displayName: Customer Tax Reg. Number - External id
entityTaxRegNum.externalId.name: entityTaxRegNum.externalId

entityTaxRegNum.internalId.displayName: Customer Tax Reg. Number - Internal id
entityTaxRegNum.internalId.name: entityTaxRegNum.internalId

estGrossProfit.description: Estimated Gross Profit: Read-only field that equals the revenue amount minus the Est. Cost. At the transaction level, it equals the gross profit of all lines, factoring transaction-level discounts and markups.
estGrossProfit.name: estGrossProfit

estGrossProfitPercent.description: Estimated Gross Profit Margin, as a percentage: Read-only field that equals the Est. Gross Profit divided by revenue, expressed as a percentage. At the transaction level, it equals the gross profit percent of all lines, factoring transaction-level discounts and markups.
estGrossProfitPercent.name: estGrossProfitPercent

exchangeRate.description: Defaults to the current currency exchange rate as defined in the currency record. This is only settable (and required) on an Add.
exchangeRate.name: exchangeRate

excludeCommission.description: If True, the return authorization does NOT generate a commission amount. The Commissions feature must be enabled in your account to set this field.
excludeCommission.name: excludeCommission

fxAccount.externalId.displayName: Foreign Currency Adjustment Revenue Account - External id
fxAccount.externalId.name: fxAccount.externalId

fxAccount.internalId.displayName: Foreign Currency Adjustment Revenue Account - Internal id
fxAccount.internalId.name: fxAccount.internalId

intercoStatus.value.description: Intercompany Transaction Status can be:    * Linked - intercompany order has been paired with an intercompany order in another subsidiary.    * Pending - iintercompany order has not been paired with a corresponding order in another subsidiary.    *  Rejected - intercompany purchase order or vendor return authorization cannot be paired with a sales order or return authorization because it contains incorrect information, such as subsidiary, currency, amount, or other detail.
intercoStatus.value.name: intercoStatus.value

intercoTransaction.externalId.description: Identifies the intercompany order in another subsidiary that this order is paired with.Order pairs are Sales Order/Purchase Order and Vendor Return Authorization/Return Authorization.
intercoTransaction.externalId.name: intercoTransaction.externalId

intercoTransaction.internalId.description: Identifies the intercompany order in another subsidiary that this order is paired with.Order pairs are Sales Order/Purchase Order and Vendor Return Authorization/Return Authorization.
intercoTransaction.internalId.name: intercoTransaction.internalId

intercoTransaction.name.description: Identifies the intercompany order in another subsidiary that this order is paired with.Order pairs are Sales Order/Purchase Order and Vendor Return Authorization/Return Authorization.
intercoTransaction.name.name: intercoTransaction.name

isTaxable.description: Place a check mark in this box if this return is taxable.
isTaxable.name: isTaxable

job.externalId.description: Select the job associated with this return.
job.externalId.name: job.externalId

job.internalId.description: Select the job associated with this return.
job.internalId.name: job.internalId

job.name.description: Select the job associated with this return.
job.name.name: job.name

leadSource.externalId.description: Select the lead source this transaction is associated with.If you use the Marketing Automation feature, your list of lead sources is your list of campaigns.If you do not use Marketing Automation, you can create new lead sources at <_TABNAME=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > CRM Lists > New.
leadSource.externalId.name: leadSource.externalId

leadSource.internalId.description: Select the lead source this transaction is associated with.If you use the Marketing Automation feature, your list of lead sources is your list of campaigns.If you do not use Marketing Automation, you can create new lead sources at <_TABNAME=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > CRM Lists > New.
leadSource.internalId.name: leadSource.internalId

leadSource.name.description: Select the lead source this transaction is associated with.If you use the Marketing Automation feature, your list of lead sources is your list of campaigns.If you do not use Marketing Automation, you can create new lead sources at <_TABNAME=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > CRM Lists > New.
leadSource.name.name: leadSource.name

location.externalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Locations. This field is required when Make Locations Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.
location.externalId.name: location.externalId

location.internalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Locations. This field is required when Make Locations Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.
location.internalId.name: location.internalId

location.name.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Locations. This field is required when Make Locations Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.
location.name.name: location.name

memo.description: If you wish, enter a memo to describe this return authorization. What you enter in this field will appear on reports.
memo.name: memo

message.description: Defaults to the text entered in the messageSel field.
message.name: message

messageSel.externalId.description: Sets the message to display on the form. To create new messages, go to Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > New > Customer Message.
messageSel.externalId.name: messageSel.externalId

messageSel.internalId.description: Sets the message to display on the form. To create new messages, go to Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > New > Customer Message.
messageSel.internalId.name: messageSel.internalId

messageSel.name.description: Sets the message to display on the form. To create new messages, go to Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > New > Customer Message.
messageSel.name.name: messageSel.name

nexus.externalId.description: This field shows the nexus of the transaction. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different nexus in the dropdown list, the corresponding tax registration number is automatically selected in the Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number field.
nexus.externalId.name: nexus.externalId

nexus.internalId.description: This field shows the nexus of the transaction. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different nexus in the dropdown list, the corresponding tax registration number is automatically selected in the Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number field.
nexus.internalId.name: nexus.internalId

nexus.name.description: This field shows the nexus of the transaction. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different nexus in the dropdown list, the corresponding tax registration number is automatically selected in the Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number field.
nexus.name.name: nexus.name

orderStatus.value.description: If your company uses the approval process for return authorization, Pending Approval is your default. If your company does not use the approval process, Pending Receipt is your default.The default status for your return authorization was set up by an administrator at <_TABNAME=ADMI_ACCTSETUP_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_ACCTSETUP_> > Accounting Preferences. You can change the status for each return authorization here if needed.
orderStatus.value.name: orderStatus.value

otherRefNum.description: Sets the return authorization reference number. Defaults to the previous number incremented by one.
otherRefNum.name: otherRefNum

partner.externalId.description: Sets the partner associated with this sales order. Existing partners can be viewed at Lists > Relationships > Partners.
partner.externalId.name: partner.externalId

partner.internalId.description: Sets the partner associated with this sales order. Existing partners can be viewed at Lists > Relationships > Partners.
partner.internalId.name: partner.internalId

partner.name.description: Sets the partner associated with this sales order. Existing partners can be viewed at Lists > Relationships > Partners.
partner.name.name: partner.name

paymentMethod.externalId.description: Reference to a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Acccounting Lists. This value sets the type of card. For details on how to modify this list via Web services, see PaymentMethod.
paymentMethod.externalId.name: paymentMethod.externalId

paymentMethod.internalId.description: Reference to a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Acccounting Lists. This value sets the type of card. For details on how to modify this list via Web services, see PaymentMethod.
paymentMethod.internalId.name: paymentMethod.internalId

paymentMethod.name.description: Reference to a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Acccounting Lists. This value sets the type of card. For details on how to modify this list via Web services, see PaymentMethod.
paymentMethod.name.name: paymentMethod.name

promoCode.externalId.description: Sets a promotion code to apply to this transaction. Defaults to the default promotion code (if defined) at Setup > Marketing > Marketing Preferences. Customers associated with a partner can only use that partner's promotion codes. If you select a promotion code associated with a partner, this transaction is attributed to that partner for reporting purposes. To view existing Promotion Codes, go to Lists > Marketing > Promotion Codes.
promoCode.externalId.name: promoCode.externalId

promoCode.internalId.description: Sets a promotion code to apply to this transaction. Defaults to the default promotion code (if defined) at Setup > Marketing > Marketing Preferences. Customers associated with a partner can only use that partner's promotion codes. If you select a promotion code associated with a partner, this transaction is attributed to that partner for reporting purposes. To view existing Promotion Codes, go to Lists > Marketing > Promotion Codes.
promoCode.internalId.name: promoCode.internalId

promoCode.name.description: Sets a promotion code to apply to this transaction. Defaults to the default promotion code (if defined) at Setup > Marketing > Marketing Preferences. Customers associated with a partner can only use that partner's promotion codes. If you select a promotion code associated with a partner, this transaction is attributed to that partner for reporting purposes. To view existing Promotion Codes, go to Lists > Marketing > Promotion Codes.
promoCode.name.name: promoCode.name

recognizedRevenue.description: Recognized Revenue:cumulative amount of revenue recognized for this transaction
recognizedRevenue.name: recognizedRevenue

revCommitStatus.value.description: This field provides information about Revenue Commitment(s) in the case of a Sales Order or Revenue Commitment Reversal(s) in the case of a Return Authorization.If you uncheck the Rev Rec on Rev Commit. Field, the Rev. Commit. Status field displays information about the related Invoice(s) or Credit Memo(s).The possible values for this field and definitions are as follows:   1. Pending Commitment - No related revenue transactions have been created.   2. Partially Committed - Some related revenue transactions have been created.   3. Committed - All related revenue transactions have been created.
revCommitStatus.value.name: revCommitStatus.value

revRecOnRevCommitment.description: Check this check box to create a Revenue Commitment or Revenue Commitment Reversal.    * On a Sales Order, the Revenue Commitment replaces an invoice    * On a Return Authorization, the Revenue Commitment Reversal replaces a credit memo.NetSuite creates all applicable Revenue Recognition schedules the Revenue Commitment or Revenue Commitment Reversal.
revRecOnRevCommitment.name: revRecOnRevCommitment

revenueStatus.value.description: The possible values for this field are:   1. Pending: indicates that no recognition has occurred. All revenue is still deferred.   2. In Progress: indicates that some recognition has occurred.   3. Completed: indicates that all recognition has occurred. No deferred revenue remains.
revenueStatus.value.name: revenueStatus.value

salesEffectiveDate.description: You can change the sales effective date for this transaction.The sales effective date determines which commission plan and historical sales team this transaction applies to.If this return is created from a sales order, the sales effective date from the order shown in the Created From field is set by default for this return authorization.
salesEffectiveDate.name: salesEffectiveDate

salesGroup.externalId.description: When team selling is enabled, this references a user defined sales team group at Lists > Relationships > Groups.
salesGroup.externalId.name: salesGroup.externalId

salesGroup.internalId.description: When team selling is enabled, this references a user defined sales team group at Lists > Relationships > Groups.
salesGroup.internalId.name: salesGroup.internalId

salesGroup.name.description: When team selling is enabled, this references a user defined sales team group at Lists > Relationships > Groups.
salesGroup.name.name: salesGroup.name

salesRep.externalId.description: NetSuite inserts the sales representative associated with this company on the customer record at Lists > Customers.If a different sales rep is assigned to this cash sale, select that sales rep here.To add additional sales reps to this list, go to Lists > New Employee.
salesRep.externalId.name: salesRep.externalId

salesRep.internalId.description: NetSuite inserts the sales representative associated with this company on the customer record at Lists > Customers.If a different sales rep is assigned to this cash sale, select that sales rep here.To add additional sales reps to this list, go to Lists > New Employee.
salesRep.internalId.name: salesRep.internalId

salesRep.name.description: NetSuite inserts the sales representative associated with this company on the customer record at Lists > Customers.If a different sales rep is assigned to this cash sale, select that sales rep here.To add additional sales reps to this list, go to Lists > New Employee.
salesRep.name.name: salesRep.name

shipAddress.description: Read-only field that returns the shipAddressList field value.
shipAddress.name: shipAddress

shipAddressList.externalId.description: Sets the shipping address for this transaction. This field defaults to the default Shipping Address set on the associated Customer record.Use CustomerAddressBookList on the Customer Record to retrieve a list of currently defined addresses for a specific customer. See AddressbookList.If an address has NOT been defined, you must first define an address on the Customer record in order to set a billing addess for this transaction.
shipAddressList.externalId.name: shipAddressList.externalId

shipAddressList.internalId.description: Sets the shipping address for this transaction. This field defaults to the default Shipping Address set on the associated Customer record.Use CustomerAddressBookList on the Customer Record to retrieve a list of currently defined addresses for a specific customer. See AddressbookList.If an address has NOT been defined, you must first define an address on the Customer record in order to set a billing addess for this transaction.
shipAddressList.internalId.name: shipAddressList.internalId

shipAddressList.name.description: Sets the shipping address for this transaction. This field defaults to the default Shipping Address set on the associated Customer record.Use CustomerAddressBookList on the Customer Record to retrieve a list of currently defined addresses for a specific customer. See AddressbookList.If an address has NOT been defined, you must first define an address on the Customer record in order to set a billing addess for this transaction.
shipAddressList.name.name: shipAddressList.name

subTotal.description: This is a read-only field that returns the total before any discounts, shipping cost, handling cost or tax is added to the order.
subTotal.name: subTotal

subsidiary.externalId.description: This field shows the subsidiary associated with this transaction.
subsidiary.externalId.name: subsidiary.externalId

subsidiary.internalId.description: This field shows the subsidiary associated with this transaction.
subsidiary.internalId.name: subsidiary.internalId

subsidiary.name.description: This field shows the subsidiary associated with this transaction.
subsidiary.name.name: subsidiary.name

subsidiaryTaxRegNum.externalId.description: This field shows the tax registration number of the transaction nexus. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different tax registration number in the dropdown list, the corresponding nexus is automatically selected in the Nexus field.
subsidiaryTaxRegNum.externalId.displayName: Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number - External id
subsidiaryTaxRegNum.externalId.name: subsidiaryTaxRegNum.externalId

subsidiaryTaxRegNum.internalId.description: This field shows the tax registration number of the transaction nexus. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different tax registration number in the dropdown list, the corresponding nexus is automatically selected in the Nexus field.
subsidiaryTaxRegNum.internalId.displayName: Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number - Internal id
subsidiaryTaxRegNum.internalId.name: subsidiaryTaxRegNum.internalId

subsidiaryTaxRegNum.name.description: This field shows the tax registration number of the transaction nexus. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different tax registration number in the dropdown list, the corresponding nexus is automatically selected in the Nexus field.
subsidiaryTaxRegNum.name.name: subsidiaryTaxRegNum.name

syncPartnerTeams.description: Check this box if you want to update the sales team on the customer's record with changes you make here.
syncPartnerTeams.name: syncPartnerTeams

syncSalesTeams.description: Check this box if you want to update the sales team on the customer's record with changes you make here.
syncSalesTeams.name: syncSalesTeams

taxDetailsOverride.description: Check this box to override the tax information on the Tax Details subtab of the transaction. Only roles with at least the Edit level of the Tax Details Tab permission can override the tax details.
taxDetailsOverride.name: taxDetailsOverride

taxItem.externalId.description: NetSuite inserts the tax item for this customer from the record at Lists > Customers. To credit a previous sale, duplicate the tax item from that sale.
taxItem.externalId.name: taxItem.externalId

taxItem.internalId.description: NetSuite inserts the tax item for this customer from the record at Lists > Customers. To credit a previous sale, duplicate the tax item from that sale.
taxItem.internalId.name: taxItem.internalId

taxItem.name.description: NetSuite inserts the tax item for this customer from the record at Lists > Customers. To credit a previous sale, duplicate the tax item from that sale.
taxItem.name.name: taxItem.name

taxRate.description: NetSuite inserts the percentage rate of the tax item from its record at Lists > Items. To credit a previous sale, duplicate the tax rate from that sale.
taxRate.name: taxRate

taxRegOverride.description: Check this box to override the values in the Nexus and Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number fields. Only roles with at least the Edit level of the Tax Details Tab permission can override the values that NetSuite automatically selects in these fields.
taxRegOverride.name: taxRegOverride

taxTotal.description: This is a read-only field that returns the result of the tax rate multiplied by the taxable total of line items for the transaction.
taxTotal.name: taxTotal

toBeEmailed.description: Causes the return authorization to be mailed to all email addresses included in the email field.
toBeEmailed.name: toBeEmailed

toBeFaxed.description: Causes the return authorization to be faxed to the fax number included in the fax field.
toBeFaxed.name: toBeFaxed

toBePrinted.description: If enabled, this return authorization is saved in a queue of return authorizations that can be printed at a later date.
toBePrinted.name: toBePrinted

total.description: This is a read-only field that returns the total of line items, tax and shipping costs.
total.name: total

totalCostEstimate.description: Estimated Cost: Estimated cost of the specific number of items; estimated rate x quantity = estimated cost.
totalCostEstimate.name: totalCostEstimate

tranDate.description: Required on Add. If not provided, defaults to the current date.
tranDate.name: tranDate

tranId.description: Defaults to the largest return authorization number incremented by one. You can overwrite with another number.
tranId.name: tranId

tranIsVsoeBundle.description: Check this box to include all items added to this transaction as a VSOE bundle.
tranIsVsoeBundle.name: tranIsVsoeBundle

type.value.description: References the credit card records associated with the customer record.
type.value.name: type.value

vsoeAutoCalc.description: The VSOE allocation amount can be calculated automatically by checking the Auto Calculate VSOE Allocation box. Allocation is the process to determine the VSOE price for items. The total VSOE amount allocated is the revenue amount to be recognized for the bundle.
vsoeAutoCalc.name: vsoeAutoCalc
